examples.question: What are all the employee names?
How many employees work in the Engineering department?
examples.generated_sql: SELECT COUNT(T1.id) FROM employees AS T1 INNER JOIN departments AS T2 ON T1.department_id = T2.id WHERE T2.name = 'Engineering'
examples.ground_truth: SELECT COUNT(*) FROM employees e JOIN departments d ON e.department_id = d.id WHERE d.name = 'Engineering'

examples.question: What is the average salary of employees?
List all departments with their total employee count
examples.generated_sql: SELECT T2.name, COUNT(T1.id) FROM employees AS T1 INNER JOIN departments AS T2 ON T1.department_id = T2.id GROUP BY T2.name
examples.ground_truth: SELECT d.name, COUNT(e.id) FROM departments d LEFT JOIN employees e ON d.id = e.department_id GROUP BY d.name

examples.question: Who is the highest paid employee?
examples.generated_sql: SELECT name FROM employees ORDER BY salary DESC LIMIT 1
examples.ground_truth: SELECT name FROM employees ORDER BY salary DESC LIMIT 1

examples.question: What is the total budget of all active projects?
examples.generated_sql: SELECT SUM(budget) FROM projects WHERE status = 'active'
examples.ground_truth: SELECT SUM(budget) FROM projects WHERE status = 'active'

examples.question: List all employees hired after 2020 with their department names
examples.generated_sql: SELECT T1.name, T2.name FROM employees AS T1 INNER JOIN departments AS T2 ON T1.department_id = T2.id WHERE STRFTIME('%Y', T1.hire_date) > '2020'
examples.ground_truth: SELECT e.name, d.name FROM employees e JOIN departments d ON e.department_id = d.id WHERE e.hire_date > '2020-01-01'

examples.question: Which department has the highest total salary cost?
examples.generated_sql: SELECT T2.name FROM employees AS T1 INNER JOIN departments AS T2 ON T1.department_id = T2.id GROUP BY T2.name ORDER BY SUM(T1.salary) DESC LIMIT 1
examples.ground_truth: SELECT d.name FROM departments d JOIN employees e ON d.id = e.department_id GROUP BY d.name ORDER BY SUM(e.salary) DESC LIMIT 1

examples.question: How many projects does each department have?
examples.generated_sql: SELECT T1.name, COUNT(T2.id) FROM departments AS T1 INNER JOIN projects AS T2 ON T1.id = T2.department_id GROUP BY T1.name
examples.ground_truth: SELECT d.name, COUNT(p.id) FROM departments d LEFT JOIN projects p ON d.id = p.department_id GROUP BY d.name

examples.question: What is the name and salary of employees in San Francisco?
examples.generated_sql: SELECT name, salary FROM employees WHERE location = 'San Francisco'
examples.ground_truth: SELECT e.name, e.salary FROM employees e JOIN departments d ON e.department_id = d.id WHERE d.location = 'San Francisco'
